channel.title: RuneWiki
channel.description:
I don't know if you all remember, but there was a Runescape wiki dedicated to the documentation of the rs2 protocols. I believe it was runewiki.co.cc (there was also a mirror of Graham's site), but obviously those two are down. If anyone could give me some information (and hopefully the wiki database to the aforementioned), that would be very helpful - I plan to make a mirror of it.
This post was also posted here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,496284.msg3628181.html#msg3628181

item.title: RuneWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:39, topic:399150”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=496283.msg3637211#msg3637211 date=1308681447]

Why bother with a new wiki when we still have the one Mopman set up, which already contains a decent deal of information, especially related to the history and background of various communities.

http://www.runewiki.co.cc/mediawiki/index.php?title=Packet_documentation

???
[/quote]So fill it in… None of us bothered with pserver shit initially because it was more interesting writing up background on da old days![/quote]
It’s sort of irrelevant where the wiki actually gets filled out, in fact my wiki has far more on it that’s important compared to runewiki.co.cc.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Ollie:

the beauty of a wiki is that you can restore to previous versions, allowing access to a few members is not the point of a wiki at all. what you need is a good set of moderators, maybe make the cms and selected members moderators of the wiki with some form of incentive to ensure they keep it uptodate and accurate.

I would have done that but no one here seems to give a fuck.

Davidi2:

oh yes because cm means you are trustworthy :rolleyes:

If you want to contribute, be my guest - ask for it.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

why not implement a system where each wiki edit is added to a queue which someone with powers then has to approve? it still allows anyone to edit but it would discourage vandalism. And since it’ll be pretty much complete when you release it, there won’t be too many edits to approve.

If mediawiki has that feature, please make me aware.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:26, topic:399150”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=496283.msg3635648#msg3635648 date=1308587691]
I chose to keep this between CMs and other individuals who’ve proven or one would think that they have some sort of knowledge about the topic to prevent false information.
[/quote]

This will be what kills it[/quote]
So how do you expect to keep the information clean and invalid? I guess I could always make a post over at mscp asking for help and just verify the data they provide?

EDIT:

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

item.title: RuneWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:24, topic:399150”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=496283.msg3635161#msg3635161 date=1308537013]
When the wiki is complete, I’ll release the url to the public.
[/quote]
isnt that counterproductive for a wiki?[/quote]
Not when only previously registered accounts can create/edit (and sysops can register new, qualified users).
EDIT: I thought that was sarcasm in the fact once it’s release it will become trashed. If you’re referring to the fact wikis are usually open so everyone can edit, I chose to keep this between CMs and other individuals who’ve proven or one would think that they have some sort of knowledge about the topic to prevent false information.

[quote=“super_, post:23, topic:399150”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=496283.msg3635176#msg3635176 date=1308538171]
Complete, pahah.

Like anything this community ever does gets completed.
[/quote]

typical cynical retard post[/quote]
Sort of rings true in the fact mutex_ registered on the wiki just to make a page about himself claiming he’s retired; anywho - the large bulk of the 317 and 508 documentation is done, all that’s left is incoming/outgoing packets with the opcode, usage, size, and interpretation of the payload.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneWiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:18, topic:399150”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=496283.msg3629085#msg3629085 date=1308069796]

Haha, which is neither mopars or mine, so that could be a fun backup to get hold of

Actually I did run runewiki for quite awhile as well, of course it was vandalized bigtime too, I’m sure I’ve got a backup somewhere if you want me to upload it?

If it has the information I am looking to mirror, yes please.
[/quote]

I believe the site at runewiki.co.cc, aka RSWiki was originally started by Mopman and it only contained general information about runescape chearing and contained very little information on the protocols.

Runewiki which was started by Blakeman iirc (might have been Graham) contains an in depth documentation of some of the protocols (mainly the 317 one)[/quote]
Yeah, I’m after blake/grahams’, I’ve informed them.

[quote=“mutex_, post:19, topic:399150”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=496283.msg3628241#msg3628241 date=1308002689]
http://www.runewiki.co.cc/wiki/Main_Page ? that works for me
[/quote]Recent changes (aka contributions): http://www.runewiki.co.cc/wiki/Special:RecentChanges [/quote]
Don’t worry about that - it won’t happen to the new wiki.

Read full topic
